A: 1. What does security mean? (a) Being safe and protected (b) Playing outside (c) Eating snacks?
2. Who helps keep our school safe? (a) Teachers and guards (b) Pets (c) Trees?
3. What should you do if a stranger tries to talk to you? (a) Go with them (b) Tell a trusted adult (c) Ignore and run away without telling anyone?
4. What is a neighbourhood? (a) A place where people live close to each other (b) A big store (c) A playground?
5. What is a neighbourhood watch? (a) People who watch TV together (b) Neighbours who help keep each other safe (c) A game with watches?
6. Why is it important to know emergency numbers? (a) To call friends for fun (b) To get help quickly if there is danger (c) To call for toys?
7. What should you do if you get lost? (a) Stay where you are and ask for help from a safe adult (b) Keep walking alone (c) Cry and hide?
8. What can neighbours do to help each other? (a) Share toys only (b) Watch out for danger and help keep the area safe (c) Ignore each other?
9. Which of these is a safe habit? (a) Talking to strangers without telling an adult (b) Always telling a trusted adult if you feel scared (c) Walking alone at night?
10. What should you do if you see someone stealing? (a) Tell a trusted adult (b) Join them (c) Ignore it?
11. Why is it important to lock your doors at home? (a) To keep the house clean (b) To keep people safe inside and outside (c) To make noise?
12. What is a safe way to cross the street? (a) Run across anywhere (b) Use the pedestrian crossing and look both ways (c) Close your eyes and walk?
13. Who can you talk to if you feel unsafe? (a) A trusted adult like a parent or teacher (b) A stranger (c) No one?
14. What does a security guard do? (a) Guards toys (b) Helps keep places safe (c) Watches TV all day?
15. What should you do when you hear a fire alarm? (a) Ignore it (b) Leave the building safely with an adult (c) Hide?
16. What is one way neighbours can protect their area? (a) Keeping their yards clean (b) Watching out for strangers and suspicious activities (c) Playing loud music?
17. What does it mean to be aware of your surroundings? (a) Paying attention to what is happening around you (b) Closing your eyes (c) Talking loudly?
18. What should you never share with strangers? (a) Your favorite color (b) Your home address or phone number (c) Your petâ€™s name?
19. What is one way to stay safe online? (a) Share your password with friends (b) Only talk to people you know and trust (c) Click on all pop-ups?
20. Why is it good for neighbours to work together? (a) So they can have parties (b) So they can help each other stay safe (c) So they can watch TV together?
21. If there are 3 security guards at the gate and 2 more come, how many guards are there in total? (a) 4 (b) 5 (c) 6?
22. A safe house has 4 windows. If 1 window is open, how many windows are closed? (a) 2 (b) 3 (c) 4?
23. There are 5 children playing safely. If 2 children go home, how many are left playing? (a) 3 (b) 4 (c) 5?
24. A fire drill takes 10 minutes. If it started 5 minutes ago, how many more minutes are left? (a) 3 (b) 4 (c) 5?
25. Our school has 6 exits. If 3 exits are used for a drill, how many exits are not used? (a) 2 (b) 3 (c) 4?
26. A safety team has 7 members. If they split into two groups, one with 4 members, how many are in the other group? (a) 2 (b) 3 (c) 4?
27. There are 8 safety rules. If you learn 4 rules today, how many more rules do you need to learn? (a) 3 (b) 4 (c) 5?
28. True or False: It is safe to play with matches? (a) True (b) False?
29. You should always tell a _ adult if you are scared (a) stranger (b) trusted (c) new?
30. What color is a stop sign? (a) Blue (b) Red (c) Green?
31. True or False: You should always wear a helmet when riding a bicycle? (a) True (b) False?
32. What is the first thing to do if you smell smoke in your house? (a) Open a window (b) Find the fire (c) Tell an adult and get out?
33. A safe place to cross the road is at a _ crossing (a) car (b) pedestrian (c) tree?
34. True or False: It is okay to open the door for strangers when you are home alone? (a) True (b) False?
35. What should you do if you find a sharp object? (a) Play with it (b) Give it to an adult (c) Hide it?
36. True or False: You should always look both ways before crossing the street? (a) True (b) False?
37. What is a fire _? (a) drill (b) game (c) party?
38. If you are lost, you should stay _ (a) running (b) hidden (c) put?
39. True or False: It is safe to share your home address online? (a) True (b) False?
40. Who helps people in an emergency? (a) Police (b) Firefighters (c) Both police and firefighters?
B: 1. What is the name of the person who helps keep our school safe? _________
2. What color light means "stop" at a traffic light? _________
3. What do you call the special number to call for help in an emergency? _________
4. What is the name of the place where you live with your family? _________
5. What do you wear on your head to protect it when riding a bike? _________
C: 1. Name two trusted adults you can talk to if you feel unsafe.
2. List one important rule for staying safe when crossing the street.
3. What is one thing you should never share with a stranger?
4. Why is it important to know your home address?
5. What is one way to stay safe when playing outside?
answers_C: To tell an adult if you get lost.
